timeline.message:
Introduce SemanticType

External dynamic types supported through FunctionNamespaceManager should only
manage semantic types because the external system cannot provide block level
APIs. Introduce the concept of SemanticType and only expose this to
FunctionNamespaceManager.

SemanticType is named type that's based on an actual physical type. We use
TypeSignature to represent the physical type. It should be verified that
this TypeSignature represents a static type.

Introduce SemanticType

External dynamic types supported through FunctionNamespaceManager should only
manage semantic types because the external system cannot provide block level
APIs. Introduce the concept of SemanticType and only expose this to
FunctionNamespaceManager.

SemanticType is named type that's based on an actual physical type. We use
TypeSignature to represent the physical type. It should be verified that
this TypeSignature represents a static type.

Introduce SemanticType

External dynamic types supported through FunctionNamespaceManager should only
manage semantic types because the external system cannot provide block level
APIs. Introduce the concept of SemanticType and only expose this to
FunctionNamespaceManager.

SemanticType is named type that's based on an actual physical type. We use
TypeSignature to represent the physical type. It should be verified that
this TypeSignature represents a static type.

We also changed the format of enum type signature from
`typename(enum:type{enum_map})` to `enumtype(typename{enum_map})` so enum types
can behave the same way as other builtin parametric types that's fully managed
by BuiltInTypeAndFunctionNamespaceManager.

Rename LongEnumType to BigintEnumType

Change the type name to be more consistent with the standard type names
because the type name could show up in user-facing error messages.

Rename LongEnumType to BigintEnumType

Change the type name to be more consistent with the standard type names
because the type name could show up in user-facing error messages.

Change the type name to be more consistent with the standard type names
because the type name could show up in user-facing error messages.

timeline.bodyText:
since it's really just a type + a name, should we call this a NamedType instead?
(semantic implies that it's a type that contains info about the meaning of your data, but you could have a  semantic type that is anonymous)
timeline.author: daniel-ohayon

replies.bodyText:
another thought: this looks a lot like an early version of what the SQL2016 spec calls a "distinct type"
"The definition of a distinct type specifies its name and the name of its source type." (section 4.7.2)
replies.author: daniel-ohayon

replies.bodyText:
if we ever wanted to support "opaque alias types" like
Kilogram as bigint and gram as bigint
such that
CAST(5 as kilogram) = cast(3 as gram)

is a type-checking error, would this design allow for that?
replies.author: daniel-ohayon

replies.bodyText: Ya I thought about calling it NamedType instead. It kinda depends on whether we want to make this specific to external types, or change this to be something more fundamentally used in parser (BIGINT the physical type can also have a corresponding semantic type BIGINT).
replies.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: Is case sensitivity taken care of here?
timeline.author: kaikalur

replies.bodyText: Hmm, the enum mapping should be case sensitive. The type name probably should not.
replies.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: Is this user visible? The names are a bit odd. Not sure if  enum will work better
timeline.author: kaikalur

replies.bodyText: There are 2 types of enums and they cannot be both of type "enum". This would be visible in error messages and plans. If you have better suggestions I'm all ears.
replies.author: rongrong

timeline.author: kaikalur

replies.bodyText: I don't know... That's what's used in code in similar situations. It's no longer recommended to not providing a locale.
replies.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: Is the signature already case normalized?
timeline.author: kaikalur

replies.bodyText: Yes, the caller normalized the signature before calling. There are tests cases to test this as well.
replies.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: Why qualified? Can it be just a simple id?

replies.bodyText: No, all external types are managed by FunctionNamespaceManager, which manages catalogs. This is also aligned with the spec as <schema-resolved user-defined type name>.
replies.author: rongrong

timeline.author: kaikalur

replies.bodyText: Built in types / types that's defined in code thus cannot be changed. Do you have a better name for them? I can use "standard types", which is sort of true. At least they are all defined in StandardTypes.java. Though they are not really the "standard type" in the spec.
replies.author: rongrong

timeline.bodyText: Is the order the same as the user given? That might be good.
timeline.author: kaikalur

replies.bodyText: Depending on how it's stored at the source it might or might not be possible to have the order as "user given". Since we are implementing it as map, that's not really possible. I don't want to make this like a map block that's too complicated. 😂
replies.author: rongrong

timeline.message:
Introduce UserDefinedType

Introduce the concept of UserDefinedType as spedified in spec16. User defined
types are managed by FunctionNamespaceManager.

The spec has more metadata specified for user defined types but we currently
only add
```
<user-defined type definition> ::= CREATE TYPE <user-defined type body>
<user-defined type body> ::= <schema-resolved user-defined type name>
    [ AS <representation> ]
<representation> ::=
    <predefined type>
  | <collection type>
  | <member list>
```
For <representation>, we use TypeSignature to represent all options above.

Enum type signature format is changed from `typename(enum:type{enum_map})` to
`enumtype(typename{enum_map})` so enum types can behave the same way as other
builtin parametric types that's fully managed by
BuiltInTypeAndFunctionNamespaceManager.

Rename LongEnumType to BigintEnumType

Change the type name to be more consistent with the standard type names
because the type name could show up in user-facing error messages.

Rename LongEnumType to BigintEnumType

Change the type name to be more consistent with the standard type names
because the type name could show up in user-facing error messages.
